Register

Innovating for a more inclusive 2030

Inclusive Innovation Tour & Factory

An Endeva initiative

Oct 18 - 19, 2017
Berlin, Germany

Event Overview

ii2030 will bring together innovators from corporates, startups, the public sector, NGOs and science to create solutions for a more inclusive society by 2030.

The Challenge

Inclusion is the Number 1 challenge of tomorrow. Increasing inequality reduces growth and leads to social and economic instability. Climate change creates risks for many of the worlds poorest. Population growth exacerbates present issues of access to basic services and income. We need to innovate to create opportunity for all.

pause skip_next

The Solution

Coupling inclusive innovation with technological advances can unlock opportunities that enable companies and other actors and to turn global challenges into opportunities for growth. Taking a future perspective and acting upon it today will ensure that we are better able to use these technologies to achieve greater inclusion and growth by 2030.

pause skip_next

How to Get There

At ii2030, we will co-create technology-led solutions to global challenges by bringing the right set of actors into a design thinking process. It will be fun, it will be interactive, but, above all, it will be a powerful engine of change.

pause skip_next

Agenda

Inclusive Innovation Tour

Oct 18, 2017 — All around Berlin

Several tour guides will take participants on an exploration of Berlin’s buzzing inclusive innovation scene to provide inspiration and information around the ii2030 challenges.

Day 1: Tour

Midday

11:30 - 14:00

Registration and Kick-off @ Mozilla

Get the low-down on the day with a kick-off presentation and instructions for your track

Afternoon

14:00 - 18:00

Inclusive Innovation Tour

Explore Berlin’s buzzing social innovation scene with a 4-hour tour of local inclusive businesses, innovative companies and leading think tanks

Evening

18:00 - 22:00

Meet & Greet Dinner

Meet and connect with other participants of the tour and conference

Inclusive Innovation Factory

Oct 19, 2017 — Neue Mälzerei, Berlin

In design-thinking workshops of up to 10 participants, we will work out how technology can drive inclusive innovation, and what is needed to realize solutions. Participants are carefully selected to bring together those actors who can make the change - and only those.

Day 2: Factory

Main program

Morning

9:30 - 13:00

Opening ii2030

Inspiring and interactive experiences will transport participants to the year 2030

Co-creation Labs 1

Work with new partners to create innovative solutions on a specific, pre-defined challenge of inclusive markets and society

Lunch

13:00 - 14:30

Networking Lunch

Over a delicious catered lunch, participants will connect with one another in our curated networking format

Afternoon

14:30 - 18:00

Co-creation Labs 2

Work with new partners to create innovative solutions on a specific, pre-defined challenge of inclusive markets and society

Closing Talk

Speaker/topic TBD

Side program

On Stage

Additional talks from leading experts in inclusive innovation, documentary screening and lightning talks

On Display

Innovative product demonstrations, exhibit of award-winning design products

Collaboration Station

Inspiring spaces will be available throughout the day for participants to solidify new connections and discuss next steps beyond the conference

Evening

18:00 - 22:00

Optional Events

Networking dinner and other social events in Berlin

Tracks

The interactive event will employ technology as the engine to manufacture solutions for tomorrow’s biggest challenges.

Precision Agriculture

How can we increase smallholder yields through precision agriculture?

Artificial Intelligence

How can we source data on low-income markets through artificial intelligence?

Drones

How can we deliver basic goods and services to remote areas using drones?

Intelligent Diagnosis and Treatment

How can deep learning transform healthcare?

Blockchain and Finance

How can blockchain technology enable entrepreneurs to access global markets?
